definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to make a deeper impression on sb
to get a better grasp of sth

sentences.english: He said to further enhance friendship, deepen understanding, deepen bilateral cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 他表示要進一步增進友誼，加深理解，深化雙方合作。

sentences.english: So you are as though attracting facts that further deepen your negative beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 所以你好像在一直吸引壞的事情來加深你的負面信念。

sentences.english: Yes, silence adds power to the punchline because it heightens the tension.
sentences.chinese: 是的，沉默爲笑點增強效果，因爲它加深了緊張感。

sentences.english: Everyday her religious schizophrenia grew, and presently she began wearing a crucifix.
sentences.chinese: 每天她的雙重信仰都在加深，現在她開是戴十字架了。

sentences.english: It can help you find love or engender more love.
sentences.chinese: 他能夠讓你更快的找到愛情或者加深感情。

sentences.english: Garden sage was used, on the other hand, for darkening light shades of brownish hair.
sentences.chinese: 而洋蘇草則是用來加深棕色的頭髮。

sentences.english: Dual cup holders are extra-deep and angled to keep drinks upright.
sentences.chinese: 雙層杯託是加深的，轉變角度保持飲品直立。

sentences.english: And this feeling of self-respect which I witnessed in him increased my love, my admiration for him.
sentences.chinese: 在他身上看到的自尊加深了我對他的愛慕。

sentences.english: Yearby year their affection for each other grew stronger.
sentences.chinese: 他們之間的愛逐年加深。

sentences.english: XXIII. . Both sides stand ready to deepen understanding of each other's development paths and strengthen political trust.
sentences.chinese: 雙方願加深對彼此發展道路的理解，增進政治互信。

sentences.english: The quickening globalization makes the interdependence on deferent nations more and more deep.
sentences.chinese: 全球化進程的加快，使得國家間的相互依賴程度加深。

sentences.english: So, you want to become the vent their disgrace and deepen himself.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的話，你想的發泄就變成了自取其辱和加深痛苦。

sentences.english: The quickening globalization makes the interdependence on deferent nations and more deep.
sentences.chinese: 全球化進程的加快，使得國家間的相互依賴程度加深。

sentences.english: The background was shaded to add depth to the drawing.
sentences.chinese: 畫面底色加深，使其更具深遂之感。

sentences.english: The leaders of the two countries visit each other frequently, promoting mutual trust and friendship.
sentences.chinese: 兩國領導人互訪頻繁，相互信任和友誼不斷加深。

sentences.english: Silences triumph through the mist of sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 所以沉默通過層層的悲痛而加深。

definition: to promote/to enhance/to further/to advance (a cause etc)
to water down/to play down/to trivialize/to weaken/to become dull with time/to desalinate/desalination
to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
